results.title: Two sides of the river
results.creator_credit: Brian Carson and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: The port of Echuca was once Australia’s largest inland port along the Murray River. This program looks briefly at life on the river in the early days and at the tourist attraction that the river and its boats have become.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian Carson and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.description: The port of Echuca was once Australia’s largest inland port along the Murray River. This program looks briefly at life on the river in the early days and at the tourist attraction that the river and its boats have become.

results.title: Bendigo pottery
results.creator_credit: Brendan Kenworthy, Trevor Lunn and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: This program gives some insight into the process involved in making pottery and shows some of the types of clay used, the preparation, pot throwing and glazing at the Bendigo pottery.

results.title: Home entertainment last century
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Tony Paice and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: An Education Officer from the Museum of Victoria demonstrates the type of home entertainment that preceded radio and television in Australia.

results.title: Is the Accord only a car?
results.creator_credit: Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description: Representatives from the Trades Hall Council (Melbourne, Vic.) discuss the role of unions and employer groups. The main focus is on young people who are just entering the workforce.

results.title: Collingwood
results.brief_description: A historical look at Collingwood which shows and discusses early settlement, farming, brewing, some manufacturing and retail activities. Includes two interviews - one with a former factory worker and one with a shoe factory worker.

results.title: Village on the Yarra
results.creator_credit: Peter Bence, Rob McCubbin and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: State Historian, Dr. Bernard Barrett talks about early Melbourne, the first landing parties in the Melbourne areas and the events leading up to its establishment on the banks of the Yarra.

results.title: STD's . . . Not just long distance phone calls
results.creator_credit: Wendy Thompson, Sabina Wynn and New South Wales. Dept. of Health
results.brief_description: An entertaining look at the ways in which sexually transmitted diseases are transmitted and how they can (mostly) be cured. Looks at what happens at an STD clinic and encourages the use of condoms to prevent STDs.

results.title: Victoria's first settlers
results.creator_credit: Lili Steiner and Victoria. Ministry of Education
